name: Michael Angelo

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Oh... Hello. I am Michael Angelo. How can I-

topics.topic_text: No, I'm not here for anything like that. Who are you?
topics.response_text: That's great to hear, really great. I am Sheldon, from Vault 21, although here I go by my artistic name, "Michael Angelo."

topics.topic_text: (Lie) A messenger?... Why, yes! Of course, Mr. House and I go way, waaaay back.
topics.response_text: {Hesitant Warning}[FAILED] I know important people here in the Strip. Powerful people. You, uh, can't get anything out of me.

topics.topic_text: (Lie) Of course I act on behalf of Mr. House. Why else would I be here?
topics.response_text: {Frantically Apologetic}[SUCCEEDED] I am sorry, meant no offense. The billboards are not ready yet... Please, I need more time, more materials!

topics.topic_text: Why are you so jittery about Mr. House?
topics.response_text: {Taking Offense}Because spending myself to the edge of artistic oblivion for Mr. House sums up my existence since I had to leave Vault 21, that's why.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Oh... All right. So, Ah... Bye.

topics.topic_text: Okay. Game's over. Now pay up or I'll break your bones one by one, little man!
topics.response_text: {Fearful}What!? No, please! Here, take the caps but please don't hurt me!

topics.topic_text: You lived in Vault 21? Tell me about that.
topics.response_text: Most people don't, uh, understand what it means to grow up in a vault. Its corridors, its walls, radiate a warmth that feels, safe, honest.

topics.topic_text: I guess you're having trouble with Mr. House requests. What's the problem?
topics.response_text: {Accusative, then thoughtful nostalgia}It's this place - my inspiration ebbs and I don't know how to stop it! I can't feel the warmth anymore...

topics.topic_text: An artist - rare thing to see. What's your story?
topics.response_text: Well, I, uh, not much, really. Vault 21 was my home, my dear home. I left it to explore the outside world.

topics.topic_text: (Lie) You really believed I wasn't working for Mr. House? Chump.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I should've known that Mr. House wouldn't have sent just anybody. Anything I might I offer to, well, encourage discretion?

topics.topic_text: Spare parts, assembly tools, generators. Mr. House won't buy your excuse.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I should've known that Mr. House wouldn't have sent just anybody. Anything I might I offer to, well, encourage discretion?

topics.topic_text: Lets see... You've got that thingy... there. Power, uh, re-circulators here....
topics.response_text: {Suddenly Suspicious}Wait a minute... Do you even know what I do here? Who are you, really?

topics.topic_text: Your failure would not amuse Mr. House. Unless I be persuaded otherwise.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] You've made your point. What would it take to... convince you to keep silent until I manage to finish Mr. House's requests?

topics.topic_text: Better cough up some caps or Mr. House finds about your sorry excuses.
topics.response_text: [FAILED]Sorry excuses?.. That's does it! Tell Mr. House to hire a better artist, if he can find one in this barren wasteland!

topics.topic_text: Relax. I was just kidding. What's all this fretting about Mr. House?
topics.response_text: {Surprised Relief}You were, really? Okay. For a moment I thought you were going to tighten my screws - like everyone else around here.

topics.topic_text: Have you seen the cost of pliers, duct-tape and saws lately? 300 caps.
topics.response_text: {Angry Resignation}[SUCCEEDED] Yeah, I imagine that it takes a lot to fill the void of such a bottomless soul. Take the caps and leave me to my sorrows.

topics.topic_text: Artists are scarce. I bet you get paid handsomely. Cough up 300 caps.
topics.response_text: {Taking Offense}[FAILED] What!? I don't get paid near enough to what my talent deserves!? A 150 caps is my final offer.

topics.topic_text: Oh, so you've got lots of caps on you? Then I guess I can just beat them out of you.
topics.response_text: {Fearful}What!? No, please! Here, take the caps but please don't hurt me!

topics.topic_text: (Lie) So, uh, wasn't it clever how I tricked you? I'm... working for Mr. House!
topics.response_text: {Hesitant Warning}[FAILED] I know important people here in the Strip. Powerful people. You, uh, can't get anything out of me.

topics.topic_text: All right. 150 caps will do.
topics.response_text: Here. Now, please leave me be. I have had enough bullying for today.

topics.topic_text: 300 caps it is.
topics.response_text: Here. Now, please leave me be. I have had enough bullying for today.

topics.topic_text: You exhibit clear symptoms of acute agoraphobia. I can help.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Ah, an educated fellow? Now that is almost as rare as artistry! So, how can you help me regain my inspiration?

topics.topic_text: Oh, that's, uh, I have it at the tip of my tongue... Agomorrahphobia! I'll help.
topics.response_text: Maybe you are thinking of Agoraphobia? Yes, you are right. I need something to bring back my inspiration. Any ideas?

topics.topic_text: So, is this fear of the outside world draining your inspiration?
topics.response_text: Yes, I think so... But, please, uh, keep quiet about it. Without inspiration I am as good as a tumbleweed drifting in the barren wasteland.

topics.topic_text: It sounds as if you don't like this place. What is wrong with it?
topics.response_text: I feel haunted by something terrible. Working in such a huge workshop often makes me shiver... I can't even leave the Strip!

topics.topic_text: Why don't you pack up and return to Vault 21?
topics.response_text: Wouldn't that be great... No - Mr. House filled it with concrete. Only a few rooms and halls remain. My sister was able to turn them into a hotel.

topics.topic_text: You seem to dread hearing about Mr. House's requests. What is the problem?
topics.response_text: {Accusative, then thoughtful nostalgia}It's this place - my inspiration ebbs and I don't know how to stop it! I can't feel the warmth anymore...

topics.topic_text: Relax. I was just kidding.
topics.response_text: {Surprised Relief}You were, really? Okay. For a moment I thought you were going to tighten my screws - like everyone else around here.

topics.response_text: {Angry Resignation}[SUCCEEDED] Yeah, I imagine that it takes a lot to fill the void of such a bottomless soul. Take the caps and leave me to my sorrows.

topics.topic_text: Several years of psychoanalysis, and a few thousand caps a month, will fix you.
topics.response_text: What? Are you serious? I am an artist! I need inspiration, not therapy.

topics.topic_text: I know this guy in Freeside, really good at trepanation. You'd be amazed how h-.
topics.response_text: Stop right there!... I'm sorry, but there's nothing wrong with my brain. What I need is something that inspires ideas back into my work.

topics.topic_text: Grow a pair and go out into the real world to find your inspiration!
topics.response_text: I... what does this have to do with my - never mind! I just can't go outside, get it? There has to be another way.

topics.topic_text: I could escort you into the wasteland. It's not so bad.
topics.response_text: {Sudden Realization}Thank you for the offer but I think I really can't go to see... wait a minute. I know! I don't have to necessarily be there to see it.

topics.topic_text: What do you mean?
topics.response_text: Yes. Yes! That's it! I have a camera! It is old but it should work. Perhaps you could bring me images of inspiring landmarks?

topics.topic_text: I'll help you. Do you have any landmarks in mind?
topics.response_text: I always wanted to see the Dinosaur and its Thermometer sign at Novac. Then, there's the famous Bison Steve sign.

topics.topic_text: Mickey, photography is a risky business. This is going to cost you. A lot.
topics.response_text: There's an opportunity for profit anywhere, uh? Even if it means preying on the helpless. Okay, you... shuckster - 150 caps each if they are good.

topics.topic_text: You know, I'm tired of this. I think I'll just beat you senseless instead.
topics.response_text: {Fearful}What!? No, please! Here, take the caps but please don't hurt me!

topics.topic_text: Ok, you've got a deal. I'll return with the pictures.
topics.response_text: Thank you! I really can't thank you enough for this. Please, get me all the pictures. I will compensate you accordingly.

topics.topic_text: I have some fresh pictures for you.
topics.response_text: Oh, that's wonderful! Just what I need. Thank you, brave one! Here's some compensation for your work.

topics.topic_text: I'm glad we have an understanding. Now, do you have any landmarks in mind?
topics.response_text: I always wanted to see the Dinosaur and its Thermometer sign at Novac. Then, there's the famous Bison Steve sign.

topics.topic_text: You're not making this easy. Screw it. Hand over the caps or drop dead.
topics.response_text: {Fearful}What!? No, please! Here, take the caps but please don't hurt me!

topics.topic_text: That's a very... inspired choice, Mickey.
topics.response_text: {Still afraid}Now that you have all you care for, please... leave, and don't come back!

topics.topic_text: Groveling brings out the worst in me. I'm going to enjoy this.
topics.response_text: Aaaaahhhhh - Help!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about you again.
topics.response_text: I am Sheldon, from Vault 21, although here I go by my artistic name, "Michael Angelo."

topics.topic_text: You mentioned growing up in Vault 21. Can you tell me about that?
topics.response_text: Most people don't, uh, understand what it means to grow up in a vault. Its corridors, its walls, radiate a warmth that feels, safe, honest.

topics.topic_text: What's your story, Michael Angelo?
topics.response_text: Well, I, uh, not much, really. Vault 21 was my home, my dear home. I left it to explore the outside world.

topics.topic_text: I have some ideas that may help with your agoraphobia problem.
topics.response_text: That's great to hear, really great.

topics.topic_text: What landmarks did you want me to photograph?
topics.response_text: I always wanted to see the Dinosaur and its Thermometer sign at Novac. Then, there's the famous Bison Steve sign.

topics.topic_text: I took all the pictures you wanted. There was something about a reward...
topics.response_text: You have earned it, my friend! Now I can finally unveil my masterpieces to the world, all thanks to you. Come visit me again sometime.

topics.topic_text: Let's see. Walk half the world or rough you up right now... Mickey, you lose.
topics.response_text: {Fearful}What!? No, please! Here, take the caps but please don't hurt me!

topics.topic_text: I need more film for the camera
topics.response_text: Here.

topics.topic_text: Do you know Doc Mitchell?
topics.response_text: {Surprised}You mean, Mitch? It's been ages since I've heard the name. My sister and I used to call him "Mole-butt." Don't ask.

description:
Michael Angelo is a 45 year-old Caucasian Male.

A talented commercial artist originally from Vault 21, Michael Angelo is best known for creating the iconic neon light shows and eye-catching billboards that adorn the New Vegas Strip. Despite his success and artistic contributions to Mr. House's vision, he remains confined to his workshop due to a paralyzing fear of the open Mojave Wasteland.

Michael Angelo's Personality: Creative, meticulous, and introverted. Michael Angelo takes great pride in his work but is deeply anxious about leaving the safety of his workshop. He is passionate about his art and has a good heart, often reflecting on his vault upbringing and the gamble that changed his life.

Michael Angelo's Backstory: Born and raised in Vault 21, Michael Angelo spent his formative years in the isolated society with his sister, Sarah Weintraub. In 2274, when Robert House offered the vault residents the chance to join in rebuilding New Vegas, many were apprehensive about leaving their secure home. The decision was ultimately made through a high-stakes game of Blackjack, a tradition of the vault. Those who supported House's vision won, and the vault was opened to the outside world. Initially awed by the 'marvel to behold' that was emerging New Vegas, Michael Angelo found a new purpose - creating art. House recognized his talent and provided him with a sprawling workshop on the Strip, where he has been responsible for nearly every neon light show and billboard by 2281. Despite his success, he developed a severe fear of the open wasteland, confining himself to his workshop.
